content: Pretty good. Having trouble listing channels though. Not sure why. When I click on list I'm given options but they don't do anything other than close.
replyContent:
Hi,

If you open the channel list, single tapping a channel will join. Some servers will not provide a channel list, though most will. If you still have trouble, please email me for support.

Thanks

content: Trying to put my friends server details. I need to go off screen. To enter details
Can't respond to ident requests. All DALnet servers immediately disconnect. Update: revised rating after dev response.
replyContent:
Hi,

Identd is a separate service that the application is not responsible for. Not only would the Android / Linux security model prevent it from running, Identd does not work behind a nat or firewall. There are Dalnet servers that do not require ident to connect. This is not the fault of this application.

content: no proxies no tor support in built
replyContent:
Hi,

The app supports ZNC and PsyBNC among others.

content: does not work as expected on my device
replyContent:
Hi,

The app works fine on Galaxy Tab devices. What trouble are you seeing? Feel free to email me for support.

content: So good/goof, I paid $4.99 twice !!! Wish I caught it before now though.
Worth every penny to be able to IRC from your Smart Ph
Love it. Except I cannot figure out how to use nick complete
replyContent: Hi, double tap the input area or use the complete character at the end of the first partial word

content: Best IRC client that can actually download XDCC. With speedify vpn, it downloads at full speed.
The biggest problem is it won't preserve where you are reading.. I'll be scrolling back trying to read history and as soon as someone types something new or I click a link, it jumps back to the end
replyContent: Hi, This is by design to prevent the app from being stuck in scrollback. If you do not lift your finger after scrolling, it will stay in scrollback. It will only scroll a few seconds after you have stopped touching the screen.

content: It's been about a month, and I'm loving the app and the customer service!

Worth every penny! At last and Android IRC client that does the job! Admittedly the developer had a lot of oldschool functionality to work into a modern interface, but they did a great job! Allow yourself to get to know the app and you'll be just fine.
Works great! Just like a windows client. How do I change the background color and the font color?
Wow! Buy this, it's worth it. I'm not especially savvy on irc, this makes it easy! The best options ..colors.. servers and chat rooms lists.

Doesn't seem to have an option where you save your favorite server to the top of the lost, so you don't have to continuously scroll through everything. And doesn't have the option of saving your favorite channels on that server so you can just reconnect to it, instead of retyping it every time... Edit: Yes it has the option of saving rooms, but I fail to see the option of saving the rooms and joining them when you want to and not automatically as soon as you connect to the server.
replyContent:
Hi,

If you long press the server in the list, you can modify the channels for auto join.

content: Can you add feature so in Twitch IRC it shows the users? Only HexChat shows users. I think it does not use default WHO command
replyContent:
Hi,

Twitch does not support "who" or any commands to list channel users.  Hexchat only shows user it's seen join the channel if that capability was enabled for the channel.

content: Keyboard did not load to type name. Update. Changed my keyboard that allowed me to type in this app with another try.
replyContent:
Hi,

This is not an issue with the app.  It uses standard text fields.  I'd recommend rebooting your phone and trying again.  If you need assistance, you can email me directly.

content: So if someone from 1 channel asks you a question like how many users you have..and you don't have to count every nick..its basic information most people would like to see .. irc is not only talk.. alot of servers channels like fun stuff...
replyContent:
Hi,

You can run /list #channelname to get the user count.  Was there something else you need help with?

content: Excellent app. Was on my end.
replyContent: IRC is likely blocked by your cell provider.  Try from WIFI.

content: On Android 10 on my device, the application doesn't stay connected when it's in the background.
replyContent:
Hi,

The app has many features to ensure it remains connected and running in the background.  You likely have a battery saver app killing the application. You should exempt it from any such applications.

content: Is there any way to keep logs locally? like even if I disconmect and reconnect? I connect to a ZNC and it keeps logs.
replyContent:
Hi,

Logging is available on a per channel/user basis if you open the channel settings window.  You can also enable it by default in the server preferences.

content: Hi, I hope you add /hop command to rejoin channels when you are inside, its like a cycle command, also /names #channel, will refresh nicklist, and woukd be awesome if you add /whois option to NOT open on external window and display it on active window please, I have so many suggestions, thanks ! let me know if want more ideas/suggestions , thanks.

Thanks for the quick implementation of the mirc extended colours codes. Am extremely impressed with customer service. I highly recommend this app for anyone who uses IRC. It works especially well on a tablet. As a mirc game developer I am also extremely cognizant of customer feedback. Great job!
Tested it out to see if I could still connect to my favorite server when I was younger. (TMD movies) connects just fine. This client doesn't seem to support XDCC however.
Best irc app so far. Can't give 5star due to issue with user list, where the list position keep resetting to top position which is annoying. Fix that then I will consider to change my rating.
replyContent:
Hi,
This is on my list to be fixed soon.

content: Very good support, and it might be the best irc client for android so far. It will be nice to have an option to switch to light mode.
Great App!! anyways, is there a way on how to auto accept when receiving files?😁
replyContent:
Hi,

Thanks for the feedback.  Auto accept is not a feature at this time but is on my list to add in the future.

content: Great IRC APP with really nice features. As mentioned in other reviews, the developer is extremely fast at responding to support requests. There are free IRC client APPs out there however they aren't as stable/reliable and they certainly don't have a developer as attentive and supportive as the developer for this one - not in my experience anyway, and I've been on IRC for 21 years (ex-androIRC user). Great value for money, worth every penny. Thank you. Regards, Dizmo.

This would get a 5 easily if I new how to locate my downloaded files, I can't find any downloads on my phone at all except for the search result text file. It is very frustrating. Thank you to the dev's for helping me out!
replyContent:
Hi,

Your downloaded file locations depends on the android version.  They're likely under /SD card/Android/data/com.countercultured.irc4android/

content: Outstand app and excellent support! I had a question I sent to the author and had a response within 30 minutes. Outstanding! The app is well designed and works great!
Happened to stumble across this kudos to the Developers
Great little irc APP!!!

Hard to use, many flaws. Where to begin..: users list is so narrow I can't even see one third of the users'nicks - this list should be expandable from the right and wide enough. Highlighting should be more prominent to stand out. Critical -> auto-scrolls to bottom of chatlog on every new message so I can't read offscreen messages on busy channels (and not so busy)! Holding the finger when sliding is not an option - as soon as you release the finger to scroll further, new messages kick in and reset the position. Last updates don't load ZNC buffer fully. Other apps load it normally. Edit: I'm not using the app, I used another one and this was as a backup. Unfortunately with the new phone the other one is not supported. There is a severe shortage of IRC apps. Either way, I'll seek another one this time too. Amazing is how many years passed and major flaws that are easy to fix are not fixed.
replyContent: As mentioned, If you hold your finger on the screen after a scroll move, it will not scroll down. If you're not happy with the app, send me an email and I'll refund you.  Simply start scrolling again before lifting if you wish to stay scrolled.  There is a delay where it will not scroll after a touch event added for specifically this issue.

content: Really clean app, works well!

1)For anyone trying to do file transfers over IRC, this is the only android app i've found that can do it (I tested every one I could find as of like 5 months ago). ---------------------------------------------------------2)I had a brief issue with the app (I think my phone was the problem) and emailed the developer who responded within the hour instructing how to fix it. I don't get that level of responsiveness from my wife, never mind most services. Seriously blown away.
Great IRC Client!
This is simply THE best IRC app if you're using a BNC/ZNC, none of the others handle them so smoothly or are as easy to set up. Thank you :)
Software is useless doesn't work in any irc servers. Thank you
replyContent:
Hi,

The app obviously works fine.  Your provider is likely blocking access to IRC.  I'd recommend attempting to connect from a wireless network.

content: Developer is extreme responsive! When I encountered issues with a new phone the the developer was prompt to respond with an update. Works as described. Highly recommended!
Best mobile IRC client.
To me this is much like mIRC only almost better, excellent app for IRC and well worth paying for, thanks for developing it!
App crashes any time connection changes from wifi to cellular. Pretty much useless unless you only have one connection. Only app I have with this issue.
replyContent:
Hi,

This is likely an issue with your device as I do not have any reports of crashing when changing connection type, nor have I ever encountered this issue. If you need further assistance troubleshooting, please send me an email.

content: Clean design, minimal, but fully functional IRC client. I got it after a major ad-supported client would repeatedly disconnect from my ZNC. The connection with 'IRC for Android" is much more stable. Well worth the money for those running their own bouncers. Better than IRCCloud.
App is OK. Could be better, but... * app settings are non intuitive * only 1 alternative name possible * cannot load some history lines on connect
DCC WORKS! The only app around where DCC file transfer works fully, even for large files. This alone makes it well worth the $5. Thanks!
Works amazingly well, very small on size with plenty of features, I like it.
really great app for chatting works the best out of them all! also very user friendly
Works without any problems.

After unsubscribing from IRCCloud I went through quite a few various IRC clients for Android, and none of them had neither the features I needed nor the stability that's necessary when one's on the go.   IRC for Android has all the features I was looking for. It has no problem connecting to passworded servers and successfully manages to stay connected to my ZNC whenever I'm out.   The only downside of this client is the user interface -- it needs work. Other than that, it's top notch.
Excellent app. The only request I have is to make it possible to select which folder DCC files are saved to, instead of just the Download folder. But thats a minor thing. Everything else is great.
Excellent App & Super Responsive Support!
I enjoy this client very much, but if there is an ignore list I can't find it. If there isn't one, there absolutely should be.
replyContent:
Hi
If you long press a user in the list, you can select ignore.
Hi Cristian, if you contact me, I will refund you.  I had no control of the app being removed from the play store.  Send me an email with your transaction IDs.

content: There was a little bit of learning curve in using this app, as I have been using AndroIRC for the past several years and am much more familiar with how it works, but so far this is a great app! The only thing I would suggest right now is adding text formatting (bold, italics, etc), and finding some way for text colors and formatting to be indicated in the logs. Other than that, it's a very nice app!
replyContent:
Hi
The server you're connecting to is probably enforcing a nick length limit. If you have tried adjusting it in the edit server screen and that still happens, it's definitely the server.

content: it works super well, my only reason for taking a star away is the unchangeable black background, why can't we have a white background to see certain text easier?

I really love this IRC client! I do have a small issue though. For whatever reason, I get a notification whenever somebody says/actions "blink" or "blinks". What's up with that? Edit: Thanks for the fix. Never would have figured that was the issue.
replyContent: Hi, unless you specify a nickmatch string, it will match against the first 3 letters of your nick

content: this app is pretty good, has more in it than I'll ever use. I am still wanting a Notify List that actively let me know when my IRC contacts are on IRC

would love to modify colors for voice normal hop op sop etc. but this is the best app I have come acrossed. dev is awesome also. oh ya would love to use 12hr time as a majority does not use 24hr time.i never liked 24hr time. so I dont use time stamps until it can be used for 12hr. if it's there I never found it
Quick responses, easy to use app
replyContent:
Hi,

The app will first try to download to your standard downloads folder, and if it doesn't have permission, it will write to it's own app folder.

Please check /sdcard/android/data/com.countercultured.irc4android/files/Download

content: Couldn't connect to freenode - server said SASL was required. App notes says SASL is supported, but I can't find any settings to enable or configure it.
replyContent:
Hi,

Long press a server name and select edit.  From there you will have all necessary settings to configure SASL for that server. Please test and revert  back.

content: Excellent work. Constant stream of updates is unheard of for an IRC app on Android. Well worth the money. Keep it up!

Used it a lot in the past but nowadays I'm no longer using it due to the lack of aliases feature which is compulsory for me. There's only one native android client to provide that -- Revolution IRC! Check it out... Instead, I'm currently using weechat-android which is just a relay to my server's weechat irc client. A big plus because I can use my own scripting there. So long IRC for Android!
Great app.
Great app, best IRC app on android.
replyContent:
Hi,

What do you mean CTCP is not connecting?  CTCP does not require any connections.  Please email me directly for assistance.

Turned off actions bar. Now I can't turn it back on. No options to turn off 'swipe left and right to change channels' as far as i can see These seem like problems but it's just minor ui things. App is great

content: I'm really enjoying this application this is truly an exceptional application I love it just want to say thank you for your hard work and keep on being great

The app is exactly as shown in the screen shots in the listing.

content: Awesome all around.Get DCC resume into the mix and I'm rating that app 5 stars. Almost 4 years now, still use it. Still hopeful I'll see this app with DCC resume at some poi point.

Earlier I gave this less than 5 stars because I didn't know all of the features. Now that I am more comfortable with it, yes, full 5! It is much more stable than the "other" android IRC client, and maintains its connection better. One thing, tho. Is there a setting to close it when the device sleeps or screenlocks? Often I have left IRC running and have found the battery dead in the morning. The device should have been asleep. Just a PEBCAK problem I'm sure. Fine app.
replyContent:
Hi,

Help is on the menu on the server select screen.  There are currently no aliases.  You can generally do /nickserv identify ....

content: works well enough. occasionally updates to the app will break it for a number of releases, then get fixed later on. newest version for me with all settings unchanged now shows the server, the mod, and the auth channel, all in seperate tabs, which is a bit silly. have not figured out how to turn off this 'feature'
replyContent: If your phone is rebooting, it has nothing to do with this app.  It does not have any permissions that could cause your phone to become unstable.

content: AndroidIRC cannot stay connected to any channel without disconnecting for no reason after a few minutes. Such a shame since this app, out of all the others, seemed to have the most promise. Sadly this is an app to avoid.
replyContent:
IRC will remain connected better than any of the similar apps on the Play store.  There are settings to ensure this.

First, make sure the app is exempt from power saving, doze mode, or any other battery saving features.  If you're still having trouble, you should adjust the ping interval under client behavior.  If you still need help, email me

content: supports dcc file send, hurray!

Functional and intuitive, with a few UI annoyances. No ability to turn off swipe gestures for channel switching, and no way to set global channel ignores - you have to set it for each channel. Otherwise great.

I have used multiple IRC programs in the past on both PC and Android this is by far one of the best experiences with Android that I have ever had. I am what is considered a power user for IRC as I have used multiple different relays for my IRC connection from WeChat to even a znc bouncer as well as with irccloud. I have missed some functionality with irccloud that I have with this app I would rank this is neck-and-neck with one of the best clients I have ever used and it is equal in my experience with even mirc. This app would have only gotten four stars as message splitting was not a functionality but I emailed the app designer and requested that functionality and they have implemented it

Bought this app after finding out that my previous app didn't work the way it did 2 yrs ago. I have been happy with this app, it was easy to figure out for the most part. I e-mailed the dev with a question and had it answered within minutes of sending. Will recommend this app to friends. Thanks

Too many app crashes when I try to copy text and links from channels or direct messages and then I loose the chat history even though I'm connected through a ZNC. Double clicking on a username to start a convo would be great. Another thing is, how do I hide the user list without going into settings? Like we have a box with error to bring it out, I'd like a sane for it ti go back in. Other than that. I'm happy for now
replyContent:
Hi,

You can hide the userlist by swiping it to the right.  Also, if you can reliably crash the client, please email me the steps to do so and I will see if it is a bug with the client itself or with android.  Thanks!

content: kick ass irc client!

It's an okay IRC app, i like it better than the other irc client i was using but it badly needs message splitting, *clip*.  EDIT: I have been informed by the developer that the feature is now available, awesome! Few developers respond directly, money well spent!
replyContent:
Hi,

You're the first user to request this, however message splitting has now been added as of 2.1.47.

content: Seems to work well - not sure how to configure it to send commands after you've connected to the server. But I'm sure its there.  Could probably do with some better help on configuration. Also the search button doesn't seem to appear on the latest version of gboard.

Hi,

You can configure commands to run on connect if you long press one of the servers.  There's a text box to enter the commands that are run after connect as if you'd typed them.

But I will let others know how good the app and dev is.

The latest release should fix the issue you were experiencing.

content: Worked perfectly apon install. Full featured irc client for Android, look no further.

Its everything nice i like that app, just i give you 5 starts if you can do

content:
This app has 0 examples of how to add a new bnc server and if you scroll to 
the bottom there is no website for this app... it just takes you to the app 
page in this store!!!
replyContent:
Hi,

You add a BNC server the same way you would add a normal server.  You simply enter the information of your server and password.  I respond quickly to email requests, and would have been happy to help you with this had I received a message.

content:
This is the ONLY Android IRC client that supports DCC properly. If you need 
this functionality, this is your only choice. Other than that - a stable 
and decent IRC client. The developer is also very helpful. Thanks

Currently my tentative go-to IRC client when on the go. However, it would 
be nice to have message splitting for when the character limit is exceeded, 
so that part of a message doesn't get lost because of length.

Just purchased this. Very nice UI!  One small improvement I think would be to add a little padding to the channel container. (Or provide it as a display setting)  Half of the first character of each line is hidden beneath my imperfectly placed screen protector. :/

Very user friendly and stable. Runs well on my tablet and phone. Adjusting the font size was very helpful for my phone as default was all confusing. Worth the money. Well done dev!  Edit: some helpful features from the original IRC would be an auto accept function for DCC and also a RESUME function. So many unfinished files that need to be restarted from scratch...
Kept crashing my phone. Also not as intuitive as other free apps.
replyContent:
Hi,

Android apps like this which do not require privileges are not responsible for your phone crashing.  This is a blackberry bug.

content: DCC works!!!
Imho, this is the best Android IRC client available. =)

It works great. Dcc works perfectly in nougat, which all the other clients I have tried failed to do. Responses to emailed questions are fast. I couldn't ask for more from an irc client, and I have been on irc for 20 years.
Used to like this but now it constantly runs on startup, there isn't really any need for that and I can't turn it off. Need a fix or will have to disable it or uninstall it... :(
replyContent:
Hi,

You've checked the run at boot box for one of your servers.  If you disable it, it doesn't run at startup.

content: Fantastic App and Exceptional Support by the Developer. I could not ask, expect or want more from the ((IRC for Android)) App as to the App works flawlessy for me.  Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time with any of the FREE IRCs or any of the other IRCs available in the Playstore.  This is not only the BEST IRC APP available, but the customized "add on feature" support that I requested and recieved from the Developer (Rob) blew me away.  I have never in my life recieved or even expected the level of customer service that Rob provided to me.  I can't believe this APP was only $4.99 when it is worth so much more.  KUDOS to the ((IRC for Android)) Team for knowing how to do it all right!  I could go on and on but I will end this review with 1 Final Thought:  ((#1 IRC APP...HANDS DOWN...Buy It Today!))

This is hands down the best IRC client for Android, I've been using it for years. The app affords much more granular control over your experience than any of the other Android IRC clients. The competition are simply lacking in options/configuration. The developer is responsive to issues so if you have any make sure you contact them. Definitely worth the price.
replyContent: I did not remove this app.  Google removed this app due to the name and did not give me an opportunity to fix it or move the user licenses over.  Your problems are related to the app being put to sleep from your phone.  You need to whitelist it from this behavior.  Had you contacted me about any of these issues I could have helped you out.

content: Works great. It's nice to see a good IRC client that also receives updates. My one complaint is that there doesn't seem to be a way to get a light (i.e., white) color scheme. Any chance of this being added in the near future? Or is it there and I'm just missing it?
My only disappointment is that even after all these years we still have no buddy lists. My biggest irritant about cell phone/tablet chat clients.
Been using this app for years on multiple phones. Thank you for the support.
Great for amoled displays
I'd like for a way to be able to put people on ignore in the menu when you tap on somebody's name if that's possible

Everything looks good, would like to see more colour background options as the current one does strain the eyes. Also something seems faulty with dcc downloading to a SD card, files download. However, when you tap to go to file it says it does not exist. Work around is in settings to uncheck option for downloading to SD card, and should work to download onto phone storage instead in downloads. So for now I'll leave at four stars.
I've been using this app since 2009.  It's still the best damn IRC client on Android!

Easily the best android client. But.... highlighting could be better implemented. It's not easy to see where you've been highlighted, at a glance. Perhaps making the text a different colour, or making it bold, or something. The blue nick brackets don't jump out nearly enough. Also, highlights don't seem to work with actions. If someone says, for example, /me highlights Alpha... I don't get a notification for it. Otherwise, though, I have to say this is the best client by a very long way.
Been using for a while and it does most things right. Everything you can expect from a mobile irc client. Now only if I could figure out how to nick autocomplete...

This client is excellent! Please my friend, consider : 1. Being able to configure how much scroll back 2.Being able to search the entire sentence for the nick match notification instead of looking only the first word 3.Maybe an hololight theme for day use :) :) Please :)... Thanks you for your excellent irc client.  PS : Please allow us to have a white background :) ! White on black can become tiring for the eyes...
Best IRC client on Android by far. The others really suck.
For 5 dollars I would expect more features such as aliases. Really the only thing missing.
Best irc app I have ever used.
This app works flawlessly with my S8+, looks great and offers tons of features and functionality. There's really no comparison, if you enjoy irc you will love this app.

Seems worth $5. Missing a couple features that I feel are super necessary for me, though. Being able to whois, ignore someone by the menu on long press on their message tab! Also, having an option to space between messages for better formatting / readability.

This is the best irc app, I really wish I could find out why the app disconnects after an hour of two of inactivity when others do not, but for any channel OP or anything more than a basic user, this app has it all! Easy on the eyes and great on battery life.  Really wish that one issue was addressed.
It's rubbish can I have my money back

Just the best. Powerful and flexible. The only thing I'd ask for is capability to use SASL EXTERNAL so that it can be used to connect to the Freenode Tor Hidden Service.    How is nick autocomplete accomplished?
OTR encryption support ?

Best IRC app I've found so far, but it has issues with swiftkey and Bluetooth keyboards. The text input seems to get stuck open when I alt-tab to another app which locks the back button. Have to switch back to irc, click the text field, and then hit back in order to fix the issue.
Slight issue with notifications but aside from that an amazing app
Great app.. Very snappy and responsive.  It definitely feels better than any of the other clients on the market.
Stable, easy to move between channels. My only real complaint is a lack of built in and configurable themes. 8/10 w/rice ;)
Excellent interface for a mobile IRC client which can be customized to your liking. Highly functional and extremely stable. Lots of features. This client is well worth supporting.
Is there a setting for autoget for dcc downloads?
This is a stable client but the UI needs work in order to become modern and clean. It also needs font and colour customisation options.
Hey. This app is pretty good. The notifications are on point. Things work. And best of all. I just type in the server name to join. Thanks. Definitely a worth of my $5
and Practical
Works well, looks good, and no stupid, bloated interface. Uses least data out of all apps I tried.
If you ever change your default nick in settings, those changes don't cascade down to your server list. You have to update it manually for each server. A decently good app, if a bit pricey.

Hi,

As people use different nicks on different servers, this would cause more headaches for those users.

content: There are a large number of available IRC apps for Android, some good, some not. Of all of them, this is the best one I've ever used. It's stable, fast, and has the features I need in an IRC app for phone and tablet.
This is quite an amazing piece of software!
Great app, works a treat. Best IRC app for Android. The developer is great. If you find any bugs just let him know and he responds and fixes them very quickly.
There can be more customisable options given on this. The most important feature I would like is, facility to E-Mail the conversations. Interface is not very impressing though.
Invalid host can't connect

content: Whenever Im connected to wifi (unifi) . It cant seems to connect to any server of mirc. I have to use my mobile data to use it.

Hi,
This seems to be a problem with your local network or the settings you've entered.  If you need assistance, you can email me directly, but the problem is not with the app.

content: Since development ceased on my primary Android IRC app some time ago, this has been my new go-to app. I couldn't say enough positive things about it before, but now with the latest update it even works well on ChromeOS! Finally, a great IRC experience on my Pixel! Great work you guys. // UPDATE: Sent you an email; apologies for the delay...but the app is still working great. FINALLY a fantastic IRC app on ChromeOS!
replyContent: Please send me an email about the experience on the pixel.  I only have an Acer 14 that hasn't received support yet and I'm curious how the performance is.  I was able to get it running with ARC welder, but I'd like to know how it does natively.  Thanks!

content: I've been using this app for about a year now, VERY easy to set up and use, comes with pre-configured servers and has a nice pop out tray for users and channels, worth every penny!
And this one seems the most feature rich and polished of them all. Will update as I grind it through daily use. Nice job, developer!
A perfect irc app for the masses and i recommend, however refunded and 4stars for not having encrypted passwd optionavailable for my security purposes.
At this point I've tried most of the Android IRC apps. This one is by far my favorite. Feature rich, easy to use, and everything works as expected. Well worth the price.
This app is updated and performs wonderfully. The developer is also amazing - responds to bugs very quickly. I'll be recommending this app to all of my friends!
Would be better if I could find the channel log files!
replyContent: The location of these varies depending on your version of Android.  Send me an email and I'll help you locate them.

content: Re-rating this application because the previous version was removed from the store on technicalities. The previous one had 5 stars no reason to rate this one lower. Excellent customer service only reinforces that. The learning curve may be steep for some, but this IRC application works a treat. Please read the instructions.
I can't seem to find the zip/text files once I open up the ddc list. :/
replyContent: The folder this saves to depends upon the version of android you're using and if your phone is rooted.  If you'd like some help, send me an email.  Cheers.

content: The best IRC client for Android EVER! In fact, the only good IRC client for Android.
This is by far the best irc app available for android in my opinion. Every single feature from desktop apps is available, including dcc!

Lightweight unlike other clients. Has an elegant GUI. So good I paid for it again. (Developer offered to give it back free with proof of previous purchase. It was removed from playstore the first time due to having the word "Android" without a TM in it, according to the developer) Developer is nice guy and replies quick. The only suggestion I can come up with is more GUI sent commands for the very new people to IRC and more frequent updates.

The server interface often shows servers as green that you aren't actually connected to. In general, it feels a bit cluttered and could use a way to organize servers or allow one to join multiple servers with a single bookmark or something similar. In all other respects, functionality of the app has been satisfactory, however the settings within the app could sometimes use more documentation (like, how do I enter multiple keywords for which I want to be notified etc.)
The best IRC client on any mobile platform and worth paying for.

Can't for the life of me figure out how to hide the join/part messages. When you are an active member of a channel where people tend to come and go every 30sec - 1min... its really annoying having to navigate through a ton of join/part messages.  Every IRC Client should have this option; but this client seems to be missing it... I may just be overlooking the setting some where, but I went through every menu/setting I could find several times, double, and triple checking.. it's not there!
replyContent:
Hi,  The client is not missing this feature.  Just click the channel settings menu button and tap the buttons to ignore joins, parts, and quits.

Were you able to find this feature ok?

content: Way the best
Best irc app for mobile. No doubt
Causes ban due to flooding issues

things missing:  1) OTR support... 2) being able to define allowed ssl ciphers .. (instead of using broken/weak ciphers on most android phones  (rc4-md5 for example.)  ...    ++ devel responds very quickly to email....   definitely worth the price.

Best IRC client app I've ever used.  Works great with external BT/USB keyboards.  WELL worth the price. Request: A /window or /win command to switch to a window name and/or number. Thanks for a fantastic app!

(Edit) Could use a prompt for actions such as kick, and ban. I find it easy to accidentally kick/ban somebody on touch screens. (Addon support like HexChat would be nice too). Otherwise Best out there for Android.
replyContent:
Hi,

This app supports IRC based proxies such as ZNC and PsyBNC.  SOCKS servers are banned from most IRC networks.

content: Stable, very good client
I have tried all of the free clients and this one is way better. Also the author is very quick to respond via email to help with the app.
Above and beyond anything else.
I like this app so much I paid again for it.

I've been using IRC for Android for a couple of weeks and have found it to be a great client, much better on resources than other clients. I am however severely missing the ability to filter out Join/Part messages as certain IRC rooms that I frequent regularly (I use a bouncer so my connection is always alive) get flooded with them constantly, making it hard to follow a conversation. EDIT: Found it. Channel list Menu. EDIT 2: Author is very quick at responding to any questions and is incredibly helpful!!!!
It seems like I'm not getting any notifications for /me in private messages. Other than that it seems really good so far.

Client easily causes excess flood errors when auto-connecting to multiple servers. There is a workaround by moving your channel list to the script section and add a delay between connects, such as '/delay 2 /join #channel'. My Freenode account or IP has been banned due to too many failed connection attempts. A potential workaround to avoid this issue may be to disable automated reconnect.
Thank you for all the work you've done, it's simply perfect. Using it for years, but just crossed my mind that i have to thank you :)

I have found nothing missing here with the understandable exception of user custom command buttons (eg common replies in PMs).   The level of detail available to automate server connection rivals full laptop clients like xchat.   Loggng and basic channel operator commands are intuitive to access.   All in all,  this is an extraordinarily clean, complete,  and useable IRC client for a small screen.   Try it!   You'll like it!
Kept crashing, no highlight color
replyContent: Hi, Please retest.  I've added workarounds to fix bugs introduced by LG's software.

content: Was gonna make my own IRC app, until i realized this one was already there, being badass.
Bought the app 2 years ago. Love that it has dcc get functionality. And the customer service when I contacted him was awesome.

I got the app back in 2010 and highly recommend it and the seller refunded my repurchase of the app with in 15min of emailing him I highly recommend this app if I had to complain about something since this is a review it would be RC5 for SSL but I think that's cause of a android limit as no android irc client does more then that
I've recommended this app to several of my other irc friends. They like it just as much as I do.
replyContent: Thanks!

content: Perfect!
Best client out there for IRC on Android. No proxy settings yet put still nice.
Only the random crashing keeps me from giving 5 stars. Lately there's been a lot, for example sometimes opening my browser shuts the client down completely.
replyContent:
Hi,

Please submit a crash report.  I literally do not see any crashes in my console.  This is likely your phone running out of memory and killing the app.

content: I've tried every android app available on the market and this is the only one I actually like. the design is simple and easy to use and gives me all the features I need without being hidden away in some obscure menu.

It shows 'Disconnected:1' even though have connected to the server using psyBNC.. Whois window cant copy text and extra field whois shows in Status.. Better have option to see all Whois field on Status or active windows so i can copy the text.. The rest it was the best irc apps in d world!!!!
Subject says it all.

I am another re-purchaser!  This is by far the best IRC app for Android that I've ever found, and probably beats the pants off of everything you've tried so far.  Get it.  As for Google's actions regarding this item in the Play store, I have to wonder if they've committed any illegal acts, since they've conveniently (and silently) removed all record of my previous purchase from my account history.  That said, I did find my original order receipt from 2009, so I know I'm not going crazy.
replyContent: Google removed it due to the name.  You can send me your new transaction ID for a refund.  Cheers.

content: I'm new to IRC and going through the learning curve, but I like plenty of features and options and this has them. One feature that made me choose this one is being able to set the notification sound to my preference. Since using it more I've found more that I like. I'm very picky about the apps I choose and I paid for another one (I hate ads so I always pay) before switching to this one. NP, it's worth it.
I noticed there is no "resume"option for DCC? Kinda makes things frustrating for those who have intermittent signal drops.
Works well with ZNC, looks pretty and uncluttered, neat timestamps. But how do you hide join/quit messages?
replyContent:
Hello,

You can pull up the channel menu and ignore joins and quits.

content: Great app. Works flawlessly.

Ever since the devs at the beloved AndChat stopped updating. I needed to find something new, and this has been a very easy transition. It's worth the value.   Edit:  Is there a way to keep this in the background? Or at least hide the icon?
replyContent:
Hi,

There is no way to hide the notification and keep the app running reliably.  This is a restriction placed by the Android OS.

content: I'm idling so hard right now.
replyContent: Send me your transaction id's via email so I can make that right.

content: This is the Android irc client you should be using. If you're using something else, you're losing.

No auto accept option for dcc?            Edit: thank you for your reply, but auto accept from spesific sender would greatly convenient  right? And what about  resume option on dcc? It will great for leechers :)
replyContent:
Hi,

Having your phone accept any file someone sends to you would be a rather large security hole.  You can accept DCC's with a single tap in the notification.

content: Love the app, however, as the title states, I have only one gripe thus far. When using this app in conjunction with znc and I /cycle a channel it throws my alphabetized channel list out of whack. Hoping an option could be added to auto alphabetize the channels within their server groups(I tend to use multiple servers as I'm sure others do as well)
replyContent:
Hi,

While a sorting option may be added in the future, you can long press the channel name and move it left or right to change the order.  Cheers.

content: By far the best irc app on Android I've seen so far, thanks for the tip on auto join!
replyContent:
Hi,

The app has this ability.  Edit the server in the list and enter the channels you want to join in the appropriate place.

content: Exactly what I was looking for!
Untime
Best irc app available and I tried them all, believe me.
Needs /me hilight notifications
This is the best client I used so far but it just needs download resume and to be able to copy text from chat rooms more easily
MY life MY IRC weehoo. nothing better except mIRC. 5-star
No other IRC app comes close.  The recently added ability to save DCC receives to external SD card easily makes this the perfect IRC client.
Hellow , can you add anoder mode and this mode to work with x ?
How do i tab complete nicks on this client? If its not already a feature it would be great to have.
replyContent:
Hi,

Double tap the input area.  You can view more gestures at the help page, accessible from the server select screen.

content: Recently installed this on my Blackberry Passport. What a great app. The developer customized things to work with the newest device. All over IM/Email within a few hours of me buying the app.   This app meets all of my IRC needs and I couldn't ask for anything better.

Great IRC client. Much better performance when compared to AndroIRC and Yaaic. AndroIRC has issues with BNC and Yaaic has terrible performance when left running for extended amounts of time with several channels open.  The 2 requests I have are for the ability to not show join/quit messages and being able to customize the number of scrollback lines. Other than that it has everything I need. Great app.

Some feature requests:  - Support ZNC Timestamps known as "server-time client capability specification" from the IRC specification. - Share to Android, to share text context  from apps through android share functionality and you can select one open window (chan or priv chat) where the share is sent to. - Support chan CBC blowfish encryption. cbc for query/dcc chats and Keyexchange would be killer.
So far this is the best IRC app ..

This is the only android client I have tried that does not crash or freeze from the flood on connecting to my bip proxy.  To put it into perspective, CounterCultured has renamed/relisted this app several times since I began using it, and I've paid - again - to keep using it.
replyContent:
Hi,

I'm happy you like this, but it's only been relisted once after Google removed the original due to the name :(

content: Skawt and holy told me and it's official.
I installed most of the irc applications on Google Play. This is the best!..
Still love the app. I had purchased this app a long time ago. I factory reset my phone and now I have to buy the app again. Why!?
replyContent: Sorry, Google removed the old app due to naming issues.  Contact me directly and we can work something out.

content: I'm slightly disappointed that I had to repurchase this app but it's so good that I bought it again without hesitation. The Dev should set it to connect to Rizons SSL server by default, not the unencrypted port.
Good enough I bought it twice. Works with multiple IRC servers and SSL connections.  Developer is quick to respond to support messages.

I have actually tried most of the IRC apps in the store.  This is the best, by far, the best!  It not only has a very nice interface, but reacts perfectly to IRC.  It also handles memory like an app should.  I have left the app running for over 5 days on my Galaxy S3 and it remained logged into chat the entire time..  with no disconnect or ping outs.  If you are searching for a great IRC app, the search is over! Grab this one! You won't be disappointed.
Great app, and very active and helpful dev.

Whenever I join any server I find that my nick is cropped/cut off partially. So if I set it to (as an example) "whoami" (no quotes, obviously) or something longer, it appends a tilde to the end. How can I fix this? is it a server issue or a client issue?
replyContent:
Hi,

Nick length is dictated by the server.  The ~ you're seeing is part of your ident, not your nick.  This means you're connecting without identd support, since this is not available on an android phone.

content: By far the best imo irc client for android. Dev is very responsive and fixes come in a timely manner.  Well worth the cost, if you irc, this is the app to have
Can't set download directory and not recognizing externalmicro sd card. Need channel search.quick connect bookmarks.But still one of the best I've found.
replyContent: Hi, This app has all of those features.  You should check the server settings menus.  You can contact me via email for more information.

content: Best mobile IRC client I've tried to date. Seems to have every feature you would want.
This is the best irc app so far that I've tried and I'm happy to have paid and support the future development. Keep up the great work dev! :)
Connects to my znc server fine.  Is there a way I can have it auto authenticate though.  I have tried a few different spots for the /quote PASS.....  Etc but none seem to work. Thanks :)
replyContent: Hi, There's a password field for irc servers or bouncers that require a password.  If you need to run commands once connected, you can enter them in the autorun box as you'd type them.

content: Low power use, smooth operation, intuitive controls, developer is a nice guy too. Everything you could ask for and more. Don't even bother with any other.

I had to buy this app to be able to review it except I have already bought it once and it cost me about 4.5x as much so I don't understand why I had to buy it again since all I have done was switch to a new phone. Can you explain this please?  EDIT. Thanks for your quick reply. Nah it's cool. I just wanted to know what was going on and you clarified it very well so there is no need for refund. The app is great so I am happy.
replyContent:
Hi,

Google took down the previous app because of the name and would not let me republish it with the same package name.

content: Long time mIRC user thus used to perfection/powerful UI. Wanted a nice Android IRC client, tried em all, and this is the most complete one by far. Its the only one with channel mode dialog making modes and topic changes way easier on a touch screen than all others available. Wish for scripting & advanced features like integration with media players/Poweramp to share track in IRC. And phone specs, etc. Google took this down due to trademarked use of Android name. Dev promptly refunded/repurchased .. Thanks.
Always adding new features. Very good irc client and definitely the most active one.

This is by far the best IRC app out there. It just does the right thing. Well worth the price and more. The dev has done an excellent job. It has all the features you could want and looks great despite running on a mobile screen. I highly recommend it.

I have been repeatedly recommended to use this app, and I have finally taken the plunge to do so. Initially I had some issues connecting to my bouncer, but this was the fault of SwiftKey inserting a space after my user. There are some slight kinks, but I've discussed this with the developer, and he's going to address these in the next update, so 5 starts for such a good app!
The best IRC client for Android, period.
Awesome functionality, developer is always helpful and responsive!
Fully-featured andchat replacement, actively developed.
Very simple interface with everything I need feature wise. Never have any issues.
If you have Xperia keyboard, you have to enable the "send" button in settings since Enter doesn't work. Otherwise brilliant!
replyContent:
Hi,

This is a bug with the Xperia keyboard.  In server settings, then input, please check 'Show send button'.  This will enable an enter button on screen.

content: Best Irc client on the play store, however... It needs option to disable scrolling while running in background, as well as a devider showing how far you've read since the app was last open. Also needs user/mention/keyword highlighting. It would also be nice of there was an option to make tapping a user in the user list insert their name in chat bar.
replyContent: Hello,  The app will highlight and notify if someone says your nickname.  You can also autocomplete a nickname by double tapping the input bar.

content: Great app full featured!
Never have had a problem, just curious what happened with the name change?
replyContent:
Hi,

Google took it down from the play store because of the name and would not let me fix it, only relist :(

content: This IRC client is at least better than any other on Google Play. 5 star by default.
